intro: Coelocline acutiflora, commonly known as the acute-flowered coelocline, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine pubescence, adding to its ornamental appeal. Coelocline acutiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
